name: nytimes
text: We interviewed President Trump ahead of tonight’s #RNC2020 speech. He boasted of “a very good job” on the coronavirus and struggled to define a second-term agenda. https://t.co/v29Scio1gs

name: nytimes
text:
Professional athletes in several leagues protested racial injustice by refusing to play on Wednesday. Was it a “boycott,” as LeBron James and other players — and the Milwaukee Bucks’ management — called it? Or was it a strike?

We talked to the experts. https://t.co/fR9uhjbqHV

name: nytimes
text: RT @peterbakernyt: How would Trump be different in a second term? Really not much at all. “I think I’d be similar,” he said. Which is exactly what his supporters want and his opponents fear. https://t.co/WvrpCMs0Io

name: nytimes
text:
RT @katieglueck: NEW: hours before Trump was to speak at RNC, Biden sought to define the election as a choice between his promises of calm and Trump’s tendency to inflame already-volatile situations that are developing under his presidency. 
w/ @thomaskaplan @reidepstein 
https://t.co/pmGEFPRnnl

name: nytimes
text:
RT @amanbatheja: "He has not tempered with age nor bent to convention nor been chastened by impeachment. He says he still considers himself 'an outsider' even while occupying the highest office in the land."
Fantastic read from @peterbakernyt https://t.co/oE72FFP4V1

name: nytimes
text:
Hurricane Laura devastated areas of the Louisiana and Texas coasts when it made landfall on Thursday. Here are organizations providing relief, and tips on how to evaluate charities. 
https://t.co/SJnMmQPVWX
